Articles.Content: When will the downloads be back ?

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, MeCripp said:
> 
> 
> When will the downloads be back ?
> 

I'll start adding individual downloads once they are finished. I've re-done all the old launchers and busy making the new ones at the same time, so things are taking their sweet time. Also I'm constantly learning new tricks and techniques, which is making me go back and apply these changes to the old launchers. This is happening over and over and causing things to take longer than expected ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

Also because I've been working on all these launchers for a while now, I constantly get bored of one launch vehicle and switch over and work on another. Doing this doesn't speed things up by any means, but it keeps me sane. 

**Short progress report:**

Vega Pack (*Includes new parts for Vega, Vega-C, Vega-E1 and Vega-E2*) **95% done - Needs RealFuels and thrustCurves.**

Delta III - **95% done - Needs RealFuels and SRB thrustCurves.**

Ariane 6 Pack (A62, A64, PHH, New A62 and New A64 configurations) - **100% done.**

Ariane 5 Pack (ES+ATV, ECB, ME configurations) - **100% done.**

ULA Vulcan Pack - **99% done - Needs RealFuels.**

Titan IV Pack (IVA/IVB) - **90% done - Need to finish Centaur, IUS and Transtage.**

Atlas V HLV - **95% done - Needs RealFuels and slight texture changes.**

Soyuz ST - **60% done - This one still needs a lot of love.**

Zenit 3SL "SeaLaunch" **** - **WIP** 

Ares I-X test article - **WIP**

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-04T08:11:08Z" title="01/04/2016 08:11  AM" data-short="8 yr">January 4, 2016</time> by liquidhype**

I'll be posting all progress on the first page.

I am already familiar with those launch vehicles. The reason for not making or considering making them yet is simply because no one has shown interest in having them. But since you mentioned it, I can certainly consider making them for the game once I'm done with everything I am currently busy with, which is quite a lot.
Continue this pack with way more launchers!This pack is awesome

Is there any way we could get a test version of what's done, like the Ariane 5? ;0

Also, just some questions I've been thinking about... Are you going to have a stock sized version as well, like the earlier stages of the mod? Also, from your not-so-subtle hints, are all of these launchers going to be 100% compatible with RealismOverhaul?

**Edited <time datetime="2016-01-10T01:46:43Z" title="01/10/2016 01:46  AM" data-short="8 yr">January 10, 2016</time> by VenomousRequiem**

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, VenomousRequiem said:
> 
> 
> Is there any way we could get a test version of what's done, like the Ariane 5? ;0
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Also, just some questions I've been thinking about... Are you going to have a stock sized version as well, like the earlier stages of the mod? Also, from your not-so-subtle hints, are all of these launchers going to be 100% compatible with RealismOverhaul?
> 

Yes, test versions will be given to people who have experience with modding or are well versed in contributing to mod development. I won't be looking for people to simply play the game for 10 minutes using my mod and giving me feedback such as "it gets into orbit" and "the decouplers decouple".

 I've thought about stockifying them, but ended up going with no. That doesn't mean they absolutely won't be stock sized/stock re-balanced, it just means I won't be the one doing it. I will be looking for people who wants to help speed up development by making configs for stock, 2x scale, 3.2x scale and 6.4x scale. I basically want everyone to have the chance to use these launch vehicles, regardless of which mods or size of Kerbol system they use. The problem is, it will take forever if I am the one who has to do all of this for every single launch vehicle.

This time around I've included a "configs" folder for each of the launch vehicles that contains configs for RSS, RSSRO, RealFuels, RealPlume, KMGimbal, RemoteTech etc. The way these configs works is, they only activate if any of these other mods are detected within your GameData directory. If these mods are not in use, the configs will be left alone.

I am no config writer/tweaker, but I am a 6.4k user and as a comment, a fair few users of the (larger) rescale mods use [SMURFF](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/117992-10x-smurff-simple-mass-adjustments-for-real-ish-fuel-mass-fractions-114-2015-jan-08/), which makes its own tweaks. I don't know if you'd want to take into consideration the edits it makes, or just make it incompatible with SMURFF. Or perhaps find a way for it to overrule SMURFF's edits? Like I said, I'm not a config writer, so I don't know the possibilities
@liquidhype If you want I can make stock configs for you, and 64k configs too if noone else wants to. (Off-topic) @MrMeeb are my 64k configs now working btw?
